Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CM1 (Ctriporin analog G4K, synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (94.74%) toCtriporinI=L=K: 16%, A=S: 11%.Activity: active against S. aureus ATCC29213 or ATCC25923 (MIC 8-15.9 uM), E. faecium ATCC29212 (MIC 7.7 uM), E. coli ATCC25922 or ATCC35218 (MIC 3.9-15.4 uM), P-aeruginosa ATCC27853 (MIC >30.7 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC700603 (MIC 30.7 uM), A. baumannii ATCC19606 (MIC 3.8 uM).In vitro toxicity:  human RBC: HC50 >150 ug/ml, low hemo.lytic at MIC.Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 30 mM SDS micelles.
Literature Information.Author: Luo X, Deng H, Ding L, Ye X, Sun F, Qin C, Chen Z.2024
Literature Information.Title: Cationicity Enhancement on the Hydrophilic Face of Ctriporin Significantly Reduces Its Hemolytic Activity and Improves the Antimicrobial Activity against Antibiotic-Resistant ESKAPE Pathogens.
